quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Day and People
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, bloomsday. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bloomsday is a secular holiday, celebrated annually on June 16, which commemorates this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Joyce

questions.question: This is what some people celebrate on April 20th.
Sweetest Day, observed on the 3rd Saturday of October, originated in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleveland, Ohio

questions.question: July 22 and April 26 are unofficial celebration days of the mathematical constant Pi. Which is the third day held in honor of Pi?
What holiday is on the first Friday the 13th of the year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blame Someone Else Day

questions.question: No Pants Day is when people celebrate the freedom associated with not wearing pants. When is it celebrated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first Friday of May

questions.question: Who celebrates Ask a Stupid Question day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: School students and teachers

questions.question: Which of these is not a brand of Scotch whisky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tullamore Dew

questions.question: The Church of Scotland belongs to which branch of Protestantism?
September is the ninth month of the year.
International Talk Like a Pirate day, invented by two Americans, is celebrated on this date.
Who celebrates Mole Day on October 23?
The worlds first international football match was played in 1872 between the national teams of Scotland and which country?
Every year, on the day after Thanksgiving, leftovers provide the perfect reason for a small and quick feast,  referred to as this day.
Labor Day in the United States falls on what Monday of the month?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: September and Unit
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, iraq, rail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Cabinet Officer first assumed his duties in the month of September?
What war began and ended in the month of September and lasted 6 years?
September is one of only 3 months with only 30 days in it.
The worlds first public passenger rail service line began In September of 1825 in England.
What is the currency unit in Thailand?
In Japan Fathers Day falls on the first Sunday of September.
There is a 1987 movie named September.
What is the currency unit in India?
What is the currency unit in the Philippines?
What was the monetary unit in Greece before it was replaced by the euro in the year 2001?
Mexicos Independence Day is when?
What is the currency unit in Iraq?
The 2nd Friday of September is designated as POW/MIA Recognition Day in the United States.
The 1st Sunday after Labor Day in the United States and Canada is what special day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grandparents Day

questions.question: What was the currency unit in Germany until 2001?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Skyscraper and Currency Unit
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, kong. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which famous 102-storey skyscraper was designed by Shreve, Lamb and Harmon and built in 1931?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Empire State Building

questions.question: Which 54-floor office building is situated in the city of Dubai in the United Arab Emirates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emirates Tower One

questions.question: Which twin towers, located in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, were worlds highest buildings from 1998 to 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petronas Towers

questions.question: What is the name of the 101-floor skyscraper, which is 509 meters high from the ground to the structural top?
What is the currency unit in Costa Rica?
What is the currency unit in Russia?
Which American skyscraper was the first building in the world to surpass the 1000 feet (305 m) threshold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chrysler Building

questions.question: Name the first circular skyscraper, which is 216 meters tall, has 64 storeys and was built in Hong Kong.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hopewell Center

questions.question: What is the currency unit in Japan?
This famous skyscraper in Hong Kong, designed by the architect  I. M. Pei,  and is 315 meters high?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bank of China Tower

questions.question: What is the currency unit in Saudi Arabia?
Located in the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina - Sarajevo, this high building was the first skyscraper on the Balkans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bosmal City Center

questions.question: This amazingly tall and slender 175-meter cylindrical building in London was used for different post and telecommunications services.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: BT Tower

questions.question: What was the currency unit in Italy prior to 2001?
What is the currency unit in Indonesia?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: China and Great Wall
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, structure, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Great Wall of China is the largest structure in the world in terms of mass and surface area.
Port Moresby is the capital city of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Papua New Guinea

questions.question: How many sections of the Great Wall of China have been preserved?
How old is the Great Wall of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over 2,000 years

questions.question: How long is the Great Wall of China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over 4,000 miles

questions.question: What is the the name of the capital city of Chile?
What was the main reason for constructing the Great Wall of China?

options.text: To keep citizens from immigrating to other countries

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Protection from Barbarians

questions.question: The Great Wall of China can be seen from the Moon.
The Great Wall of China was built primarily with local materials.
Khartoum is the capital city of this country.
What is the name of the capital city of Scotland?
Which Chinese Dynasty is responsible for the construction of most of the Great Wall of China?
The entire Great Wall of China is made of bricks.
In 2002, a group called the Great Wall Academy conducted a study on all the sections of the Wall Great Wall of China. What percentage of the wall did they find was still in good condition?
What is the name of this extremely tall luxury hotel in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, that stands in the sea on an artificial island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burj al-Arab

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Capital
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, pair, niamey. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Buda, Pest and Óbuda united to form Budapest. What country is Budapest the capital of?
This pair of twin cities includes the town in which Einstein was born in 1879.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulm and Neue Ulm

questions.question: Brownsville, Texas is the twin city to this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matamoros, Tamaulipas

questions.question: Kansas City, Kansas and Kansas City, Missouri are twin cities. Which of them had a larger population in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kansas City, Missouri

questions.question: What is the capital of Burkina Faso?
These two US cities are called The Twin Ports.

options.text: Laredo, Texas and Port Charles, Louisiana
Salford, California and San Diego, California

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duluth, Minnesota and Superior, Wisconsin

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city of the Republic of Indonesia?
Detroit, Michigan, aka Motown, is twinned with this city.
Name the largest city in Israel and its neighboring port city, that are usually referred to as twin cities.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tel Aviv and Jaffa

questions.question: What city is the capital of Denmark?
Niamey is the capital city of what country?
Freetown is the capital city of what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sierra Leone

questions.question: Manchester, UK is a hub of great soccer. Which city is the twin city to Manchester?
What is the name of the official capital city of Malaysia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kuala Lumpur

questions.question: There are many twin cities in the USA. Which of the following are twin cities in Minnesota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minneapolis and St. Paul

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Countries and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, abc, factory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two countries in Central and South America have English as their official language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belize and Guyana

questions.question: In which South American country was the Nazi murderer Adolph Eichman captured?
Two Latin American countries are landlocked. Three Latin American countries are called the ABC     countries. How many of the ABC countries are landlocked?
Ciudad Juarez in Chihuahua, Mexico is twined with this US city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Paso, Texas

questions.question: Seoul, South Korea has a twin city that has declared itself an English-speaking city. Which city is Seouls twin city?
Which two Latin American countries are landlocked?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bolivia and Paraguay

questions.question: Guarani is one of the official languages of which Latin American country?
Juan Santamaria, Franklin Chang-Diaz, Oscar Aria Sanchez, and Claudia Poll are famous people from  which Latin American country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Costa Rica

questions.question: Although these are twin cities, they are in different time zones.

options.text: Torino, Italy and Lake Cuomo, Switzerland
Sao Piemendau, Portugal and Slamonca, Spain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tornio, Finland and Haparanda, Sweden

questions.question: Which word  means a slum surrounding major Brazilian cities?
Which word means a simple farmer or a farmer on a subsistence farm?
Which of these countries has two capital cities?
The famous soprano Yma Sumac is from which Latin American country?
Excluding the Falkland Islands, how many countries in Central and South America do not have Spanish listed as their official language?
Which word means a Mexican factory in which parts made in other countries are assembled?
